meanings.definition: A small or minor work, especially of literature.
meanings.sent1: The student proudly presented her opusculum to the class.
meanings.sent2: The library featured a collection of opuscula by new authors.
meanings.sent3: The tiny opusculum made everyone laugh with its big ideas.
meanings.sent4: Her opusculum was a gem hidden among the larger volumes.
meanings.sent5: The opusculum sparkled with creativity and charm.

meanings.sent1: The poet's opusculum captured the essence of nature in just a few lines.
meanings.sent2: She wrote an opusculum on the beauty of simplicity.
meanings.sent3: The opusculum was so short, it left everyone wanting more.
meanings.sent4: His opusculum was a tiny seed that grew into a beautiful story.
meanings.sent5: The opusculum painted a vivid picture with just a few words.
